name: Hello
Good morning
I'm Kathy King.
Are you Peter Smith?
No, I'm not.
How are you?
Fine, thanks. And you?
I'm fine, too.
How is your wife?
She is very well, thank you.
Good night, Jane.
Good-bye, Mike.
See you tomorrow.
See you later.
I have to go now.
May I come in?
Come in, please.
Sit down, please.
It's time for class.
Open your books and turn to page 20.
I'll call the roll before class.
Here!
Has everybody got a sheet?
trans: 每个人都拿到材料了吗？

name: Any different opinion?
Are you with me?
Have I made myself clear?
Could you say it again?
Any questions?
That's all for today.
Please turn in your paper before leaving.
trans: 请在离开前将论文交上。

name: What's this?
It's a pen.
Is this your handbag?
No, it isn't.
Whose pen is this?
It's Kate's.
Is that a car?
No, it isn't. It's a bus.
What do you call this in English?
What is the color of your new book?
trans: 你的新书是什么颜色的？

name: How big is your house?
How long is the street?
What's the name of the cat?
Where's the company?
Which is the right size?
What's this?
It's an air-conditioner.
Is this yours?
Yes, it's mine.
Where are my glasses?
Do you know where I've put my glasses?
trans: 你知道我把眼镜搁哪儿了吗？

name: Over there.
On the desk.
Is this your pen? I found it under the desk.
trans: 这是你的笔吗？我在桌下捡的。

name: No. Mine is blue.
Which is your bag?
The bigger one.
The one on your right.
Are these books all yours?
Some of them are mine.
Who are you?
I'm Jim.
Who is the guy over there?
He's Bob.
Is that girl a student?
No, she isn't.
What do you do?
I'm a farmer.
What does he do?
He's a manager.
She must be a model, isn't?
trans: 她一定是个模特，不是吗？

name: I really don't known.
I have no idea about it.
Can she be a driver?
Yes, I think so.
What's your name?
May I have your name?
My name is Thomas.
Just call me Tom.
What's your family name?
My family name is Lee.
How do you spell it?
Who is the lady in white?
trans: 穿白衣服的那位小姐是谁？

name: Could you introduce me to her?
Rose, let me introduce my friend to you.
trans: 罗斯，让我介绍一下我的朋友。

name: This is Tom. He's my classmate.
Nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you, too.
Let me introduce myself.
How do you do?
What day is it today?
It's Monday today.
What's the date today?
It's January the 15th, 1999.
What month is this?
It's December.
What year is this?
It's the year of 1999.
What will you do during this weekend?
Does the shop open at 9 am on weekdays?
trans: 这家店平日是早上9点开门吗？

name: It opens at 8 am on weekdays, but at 9 at weekends.
trans: 平日上午8点开，但周末9点开。

name: What will you do the day after tomorrow?
What did you do the week before last?
I'll work for the next 5 days.
trans: 我要工作5天（从明天算起）

name: It's been 5 years since I last saw you.
Do you have a computer?
Yes, I do.
He has that book, doesn't he?
No, he doesn't.
Do you have any brothers or sisters?
No, I'm a single son.
Does your computer have a modem?
trans: 你的电脑有调制解调器吗？

name: Do you have shampoo here?
What a beautiful garden you have!
Any tickets left?
Do you have glue? I need some here.
trans: 你有胶水吗？我这里需要一点。

name: I have some left.
If you have more, please give me some.
Do you have my pencil?
Yes, I have your eraser, too.
trans: 是的，我还拿了你的橡皮。

name: What time is it?
It's two o'clock.
It's a few minutes after two.
My watch is fast and your watch is slow.
Excuse me. Can you tell me the correct time?
trans: 打扰一下，您能告诉我正确的时间吗？

name: No, I can't.
I don't know what time it is.
I don't think it's four o'clock yet.
trans: 我认为现在还不到四点。

name: It must be about three thirty.
trans: 现在想必是三点三十分左右。

name: I get up before six o'clock every day.
The restaurant doesn't open until seven forty-five.
trans: 饭馆要到七点四十五分才开门。

name: Will you be here at ten o'clock tomorrow?
trans: 请你明天十点到这里，行吗？

name: Yes, I will.
We'll be on time, won't we?
I hope so.
What's the date today?
Today is November first, nineteen sixty-three.
trans: 今天是一九六三年十一月一号。

name: When were you born?
I was born on November first, nineteen thirty-five.
trans: 我是一九三五年十一月一日出生.

name: Today is my birthday.
My sister was born in nineteen thirty-eight.
trans: 我的妹妹是一九三八年出生的。

name: I don't know the exact date.
Where were you born?
I was born in a little town not far from here.
trans: 我出生在离这儿不远的小城市里。

name: What do you know about the tenth century?
trans: 有关十世纪的事你知道些什么？

name: I don't know anything about that.
trans: 关于那个我什么都不知道。

name: Let's talk about something else.
trans: 让我们谈点别的什么吧。

name: Where were you during the month of April last year?
I don't remember where I was then.
trans: 我不记得那时我在哪里。

name: Where will you be nest year at this time?
trans: 明年这个时候你将在哪里？

name: Hello. Can I see Mr. Green?
trans: 你好，我能见格林先生吗？

name: Do you have an appointment?
Sorry, I don't.
Yes. At 3 pm.
Sorry, Mr. Green can't see you now.
trans: 对不起，格林先生现在不能见您。

name: He's on the phone.
Would you wait here for a minute?
Would you like something to drink?
Tea, please.
Mr. Green, Mr. Smith is here.
trans: 格林先生，史密斯先生在这里。

name: You may go in now.
Nice to see you, my old friend.
trans: 真高兴见到你，我的老朋友。

name: How have you been these years?
You've changed little.
Do you still remember that Christmas?
trans: 你仍记得那个圣诞节吗？

name: Do you speak English?
Yes, a little.
How long have you studied English?
He speaks English fluently.
Your English is very good.
You speak English pretty well.
Are you a native speaker of English?
My native language is Chinese.
He speaks with London accent.
He has a strong accent.
I have some difficulty in expressing myself.
I'm always confused with s and th.
Can you write in English?
Your pronunciation is excellent.
How can I improve my spoken English?
trans: 我该怎样才能提高口语水平？

name: What are you doing?
I'm reading a book.
I'm cooking.
Are you watching TV now?
Yes, I'm watching Channel 5.
No, I'm listening to the radio.
Where are you going?
I'm going to work.
Who are you writing to?
I'm writing to an old friend.
What will you do this weekend?
I'll go to a concert.
I'll go on an outing with some friends.
Do you like traveling?
Yes, I like it a great deal/it very much.
How old are you?
I'm twenty-two (years old).
Mr. Smith is still in his forties.
trans: 史密斯先生才四十几岁。

name: I'm two years younger than my sister.
My elder sister is one year older than her husband.
He's the youngest in the family.
He looks much younger than he is.
trans: 他看起来比他实际上年轻得多。

name: I came here when I was 20.
I started school at the age of 6.
My father is over 60 years old.
Most of them are less than 30.
I guess he's about 30.
She's going to be 15 next month.
They'll have a party for their 10th wedding anniversary.
trans: 他们将为结婚十周年开个晚会。

name: He's still a boy after all.
When do you get up everyday?
I usually get up at 8 o'clock.
Where do you have your lunch?
I have my lunch in a snack bar nearby.
trans: 我在附近一家快餐店吃午饭。

name: What did you have for lunch?
I had a hamburger and a fried chicken leg?
trans: 我吃一个汉堡包，一个炸鸡腿。

name: What time do you start work?
I start work at 8 o'clock.
What do you do at work?
I answer telephones and do some typing.
What time do you finish your work?
At 6 o'clock sharp.
What do you do in your spare time?
I like listening to pop music.
I like playing football.
When did you get up yesterday morning?
At about seven.
I heard the clock, but I didn't get up until 9.
trans: 我听见闹钟了，但我捱到九点才起。

name: I woke up seven and got up right away.
trans: 我七点醒了，然后马上起床了。

name: I hurried to my office.
I had my breakfast on the way.
I was just on time.
I was 10 minutes late.
I had lunch with a friend of mine.
trans: 我和我的一个朋友一块吃了午饭。

name: I finished my work at 6 p.m.
I stayed and did some extra work.
The TV programs were really boring, so I went to bed very early.
trans: 电视节目很无聊，所以我早早睡了。

name: I read a magazine in bed.
I didn't sleep well.
I slept soundly all night.
Hi, Joe, is it really you?
Hi, Ann. Nice to see you again.
trans: 安，你好。真高兴再次见到你。

name: It's been a whole year since I last saw you.
Yes, but you look as pretty now, as you did then.
trans: 但你看起来还是那么漂亮。

name: Oh, thank you. How have you been these days?
trans: 欧，谢谢。这段时间你好吗？

name: Not too bad.
But you sound so sad.
Yes, I lost my pet cat yesterday.
trans: 是啊，昨天我的宠物猫丢了。

name: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
That's all right.
Have you seen Kate lately?
No, I have no contact with her.
trans: 没有。我和她没有一点儿联系。

name: I heard she got married last week.
trans: 我听说她上星期结婚了。

name: Oh, how nice. Sorry, I've got to go now.
trans: 那真好。对不起，我必须得走了。

name: So do I. See you later. Keep in touch.
trans: 我也是，再见。记得联系哦。

name: I used to take a walk in the early morning.
trans: 我过去常一大早出去散步。

name: He used to live in my neighborhood.
Did you use to go fishing with friends?
trans: 过去你常和朋友钓鱼吗？

name: We have known each other for 6 years.
It has been a long time since last came here.
trans: 自从我上次来这里已经有很长时间了。

name: Have you seen Mr. Smith recently?
trans: 最近你见过史密斯先生吗？

name: They've been working on this project since last year.
trans: 他们从去年开始一直都在做这个项目。

name: I've been watching TV all night.
The movie began as soon as we got there.
trans: 我们一到那儿电影就开始了。

name: When I arrived at the station, the train had already left.
trans: 我到车站时，火车已经开了。

name: The late arrival of the ship had messed up all our plans.
trans: 船到晚了，把我们的计划全打乱了。

name: I had thought he knew the time of the meeting.
trans: 我原以为他知道开会时间。

name: They had excepted me to go with them.
trans: 他们原本希望我和他们一起去。

name: That was the third time that I had visited the place.
trans: 那是我第三次参观那地方了。

name: After I had finished my paper, I put it in the drawer.
trans: 我写完论文，就把它放在抽屉了。

name: Hi, Jack, where do you live now?
trans: 你好，杰克，你现在住哪儿？

name: I live at 203 Curzon Street.
Curzon Street? Isn't Mary living there?
trans: 可胜街？玛丽不是也住那儿吗？

name: Yes, she lives just across the street.
How long have you stayed there?
Just a few months.
How about Mary? How long has she lived there?
trans: 玛丽怎么样？她在那儿住多久了？

name: She's been living there since her birth.
Will you stay there for long?
trans: 你会在那儿待很长时间吗？

name: No, I'll move to Hollywood next month.
trans: 不，我下个月搬到好莱坞去。

name: Oh, really? I'm moving there too.
trans: 真的？我也会搬到那儿去。

name: Great. Then we can drink beer together.
trans: 棒极了，我们可以一起喝啤酒了。

name: Yes, and you may stay there longer.
trans: 对，而且你也许会在那儿住久一些。

name: I hope so.
I'm sure we'll have a good time.
trans: 我相信我们会很开心的。

name: Where are you going?
Where did you go for dinner yesterday?
trans: 你们昨天去哪儿吃的饭？

name: When will he come to see you?
When did you buy the car?
Who told you?
Who will accompany you to the airport?
Why don't you agree?
Why not go out for a walk?
How did you doing spend your holiday?
How are you doing these days?
What did he say in the letter?
What are you going to do with the books?
trans: 你打算拿这些书怎么办？

name: What were you doing when I called?
trans: 我打电话给你时你在干吗？

name: I was about to leave.
Can you guess what I was doing this morning?
trans: 你能猜到今天上午我在做什么吗？

name: What's the height of the building?
How much does the elephant weight?
What's the color of your new dress?
trans: 你的新衣服是什么颜色的？

name: What's the size of your shoes?
My brother is twice as tall as your sister.
trans: 我弟弟比你妹妹高一倍。

name: My grandma is 40 years older than me.
This river is one third as long as that river.
trans: 这条河只有那条河的三分之一长。

name: What's the shape of your balloon?
How wide is this bridge?
How thick is the ice here?
This metal is harder than that one.
He can run as fast as Jim.
Kate is smarter than I.
How long do you watch TV every day?
trans: 你每天看多长时间电视？

name: How often do you go swimming?
trans: 你多久去游一次泳？Asking For Help 寻求帮助

name: Would you please open the door for me?
May I ask you a question?
Please give me a hand.
Could you do me a favor?
Would you help me remove the refrigerator?
Get me my coat, please.
Make me a cup of coffee, will you?
Call me tomorrow if you have time.
trans: 明天要有时间就给我打个电话。

name: Could you tell me where I can find these books?
trans: 您能告诉我在哪儿能找到这些书吗？

name: Certainly.
Witch pleasure.
I'm sorry. I'm engaged now.
I'm glad to, but I'm afraid I don't have the time.
trans: 我很乐意，但我恐怕没时间。

name: Would you mind closing the window for me?
trans: 能帮我关一下窗户吗？（你介意关下窗户吗？）

name: Not at all.
Excuse me, madam. Could you tell me where the post office is?
trans: 对不起，女士，请问邮局在哪里？

name: It's just around the corner.
Excuse me, how can I get to the bus station?
You can take the bus and get off at the second stop.
trans: 你可以坐公共汽车第二站下。

name: Excuse me. Where is No.5 Street?
trans: 对不起，第五大街在哪儿？

name: Go straight ahead and turn left at the second crossing.
trans: 一直往前走，在第二个十字路口往左拐。

name: Excuse me. Can you tell me how to get to Mr. Hu's restaurant?
trans: 对不起，你能告诉我怎么去胡先生的餐馆吗？

name: Go on for about 100 meters. It's on your left side. You can't miss it.
trans: 往前走约100米，在你左手边，你不会错过的。

name: Which one is Mr. Jame's office?
trans: 哪间是詹姆司先生的办公室？

name: It's Room 201 on the second floor.
Can I use the lift?
Sorry, it's broken. You have to use the stairs.
trans: 对不起，它坏了，你只能走楼梯了。

name: Where are the stairs?
Go along the corridor and it's on your right side.
trans: 沿着走廊走，在你右手边。

name: Thank you for directions.
Are you married?
I'm single.
You have a younger brother, don't you?
How is your family?
She's engaged/married to John.
How long have you been married?
We've been married for 2 years.
My parents got married in 1954.
Mary gave birth to a baby last week.
They've been divorced.
His wife died a year ago. Now he lives alone.
trans: 他妻子去年去世了。现在他一个人住。

name: My aunt will come to live with me for some days.
trans: 我阿姨会来和我住一些日子。

name: John has his own family now.
trans: 约翰现在有自己的家了。

name: Do you live with your parents?
No. I live in my own house.
trans: 不，我住在自己的房子里。

name: Do you know Mary?
Sure. We are friends since primary school.
trans: 当然，我们从小学就是朋友了。

name: Really? I was introduced to her just last weekend.
trans: 真的？上周末我才被介绍给她。

name: What is she doing now?
She told me she wanted to start a company.
Start a company? But I thought she would be a scholar.
trans: 开公司？我原以为她会成为一个学者

name: People are always changing, aren't they?
Yes, you're right. After all, she is smart enough to go into business.
trans: 是啊，你说的对。毕竟，她完全有经商才智。

name: But she doesn't have much experience.
You two don't have much contact？
No, I only wrote her one letter this year.
trans: 是的，今年我才给她写过一封信。

name: And she?
She sent me a Christmas card last year.
Oh, that's not good.
Yes, we should try to contact more.
trans: 是的，我们应该联系多点。

name: What time are you going to leave for the airport tomorrow?
trans: 你明天打算什么时候去机场？

name: Is he coming to dinner?
I'm going to the bookstore. Will you go with me?
trans: 我要去书店，你和我去吗？

name: They're going to discuss it at the meeting next Friday.
trans: 他们将在下周五的会上讨论这个问题。

name: I'll be waiting for you at the restaurant this time tomorrow.
trans: 我明天这时候在餐馆等你。

name: After I get home, I'll call you.
trans: 到家以后，我会给你打电话。

name: How will you spend the evening?
I'll probably stay home and watch TV.
trans: 我可能会呆在家看电视。

name: What's your plan for the summer holiday?
I'm thinking about a visit to Paris.
There's going to be a pottery exhibition at the art gallery.
trans: 艺术馆将有一次陶瓷展。

name: You are still thinking about a Ph.D., aren't you?
trans: 你还是想学成博士，是吗？

name: What will you do about it?
What do you want to do after graduation?
I'll further my study.
Have you heard the weather forecast?
No, what does it say?
We'll have fine weather for the next few days?
But it's still raining today!
It is said it will clear up tonight.
trans: 天气预报说今晚雨就会停。

name: What will it be after the clear weather?
trans: 晴天以后天气会怎么样？

name: It says a storm may come next month.
trans: 天气预报说下个月会有一场暴风雨。

name: And it may get colder, it's already November.
Yes, and I hope we can have some snow this winter.
trans: 是的，我希望今年冬天会下雪。

name: I'm afraid it won't be cold enough for a snowfall.
trans: 我恐怕天不会冷的下雪。

name: But last year we had a big one.
Yes, but you know global warming may raise the temperature.
trans: 是的，但全球变暖会使气温上升。

name: You are probably right.
I'm going skating in the Alps next month.
trans: 下个月我去阿尔卑斯山滑雪。

name: I hope the weather there is cold enough.
How are you feeling today?
I don't feel very well.
Do you fell better now?
Much better.
I'm sick.
He's got a bad headache.
My fever is gone.
What's the matter with you?
I've got a pain in my back.
It really hurts.
It hurts right here.
It's bleeding. You'd better see a doctor about that cut.
trans: 在流血呢，你最好找个医生看看这伤口。

name: Call the doctor!
Take two pills and have a good rest.
trans: 吃两片药，好好休息一下。

name: I hope you'll be well soon.
I get up at 8 every morning.
I then take a bath in the bathroom.
trans: 然后我去洗澡间洗个澡。

name: I shave, brush my teeth, and comb my hair.
I put on a bit of makeup.
I cooked breakfast for the family.
I go downstairs and have my breakfast.
I read the newspaper over breakfast.
I wake my sister up.
I dress my sister and wash her hands and face.
trans: 我给我妹妹穿衣服，洗脸洗手。

name: I get to my office at 10:30.
I leave the office at 7.
I can't agree with you more.
I buy some food on my way home.
I pick up my sister from her school.
We go to bed at 10:30.
What do you think about it?
Is that right?
Absolutely right.
I think you're mistaken about that.
Is that ok?
That's ok/fine.
That's excellent.
He was absent yesterday. Do you know why?
trans: 昨天他没到，你知道为什么吗？

name: Do you have any idea?
I suppose he was sick.
Will it rain tomorrow?
No, I don't think so.
Do you really want to know what I think?
trans: 你真想知道我怎么想吗？

name: Please give me your advice.
I want to hear your opinion.
What do you plan to do this Friday?
What are you doing next week?
I plan to go to the concert.
I'm thinking of going to my grandma's.
I'll go skiing of the weather permits.
trans: 天气允许的话，我会去滑雪。

name: I suppose I can finish the project next year.
trans: 我想我明年完成此工程。

name: I have no idea.
It's up to you.
I'm considering buying a house.
Hi, Jack, what lessons will you take this semester?
trans: 你好，杰克，这学期你选什么课？

name: Hi, Lucy. I'll take French and Economics.
trans: 你好，露西，我想选法语和经济。

name: I'm taking Chinese and History.
Do you plan to do some odd jobs?
Yes, I'm applying to work at the library.
trans: 是的，我在申请图书馆管理员的工作。

name: Good luck!
It's up to you.
You have the final say.
She insists that it doesn't matter.
He's made up his mind to quit his job.
trans: 他已决定辞去他的工作。

name: I've decided not to sell the house.
I'm determined to leave.
Have you decided?
No, I haven't decided yet.
I've changed my mind.
It's still undecided.
Don't hesitate any more.
Give me a definite answer, please.
It's really hard to make a decision.
I'm always making resolutions, like giving up smoking.
trans: 我总在做出决定，比如戒烟。

name: Don't shilly-shally.
Do you like traveling?
Yes, I've just come back from Scotland.
trans: 是的，我刚从苏格兰回来。

name: How did you get there?
I got there by plane.
Where did you visit?
I only had time to visit Edinburgh.
How did you like it?
It's fantastic.
Why did you go there?
I went there on business.
And do you have friends there?
Yes, a lot of friends.
You must have enjoyed yourself.
Yes, and I took many pictures.
trans: 是的，我还照了好多照片。

name: Please let me see them.
Will you go shopping with me?
Here's your change.
I'll go to pick up some odds and ends at the store.
trans: 我要到商店买些零碎的东西。

name: Excuse me, would you tell me where I can get some butter?
trans: 打扰一下，您能告诉我黄油在哪儿卖吗？

name: May I have a look at the watch?
May I try it on?
This is too small for me. Do you have a bigger one?
trans: 这个太小了，有大点的吗？

name: Do you have any more colors?
What's your size?
It suits you to a T.
It's too expensive for me.
Can you came down a bit?
I'll take it.
How much is it?
How much do I owe you?
What would you like to eat?
Are you ready to order?
I'd like some steak and bread.
What would you like for dessert?
I'll have some ice cream.
Do you want some fruit?
Yes, please. I want an apple.
Anything to drink?
A small glass of whisky, please.
Here is your food.
Bring me the bill please.
Can I pay by check or credit card?
trans: 我能用支票或信用卡吗？

name: Sorry, we only take cash.
Here you are.
Here is your change.
I'm free tonight.
Shall we go to the cinema?
Do you know what's on tonight?
May I ask you for a dance?
With pleasure.
Sorry, I'm engaged.
What about another dance?
You're a good dancer.
What's on Channel 8 now?
I don't know. You may look in the TV Guide.
trans: 我不知道，你可以看看《电视报》。

name: Let's see what else is on.
trans: 咱们看看有没有别的节目。

name: Did you see the special last night?
trans: 昨晚你看特别节目了吗？

name: I don't want to see any more of this TV show.
trans: 我不想再看这个电视节目了。

name: Can we change the channel?
I want to see the weather.
I'd like to make an appointment with Mrs. Green.
trans: 我想约个时间见格林女士。

name: She's free on Friday and Saturday.
Sorry, can I see her before Friday?
trans: 对不起，我能周五之前见她吗？

name: Let me see. She has 30 minutes Tuesday afternoon.
trans: 让我查查，她周二下午有30分钟。

name: At what time?
From 4 to 4:30.
All right.
So you'll come then. Please phone in if you can't make it.
trans: 那么你就那时来，如果来不了，请打电话给我。

name: I have an interview this afternoon.
I can come any time except Sunday.
You can reach me at 6609823.
He phoned to cancel the meeting.
Please call me before you come.
Please make an appointment with my secretary.
trans: 请跟我秘书定个见面时间。

name: I have to change my appointment from Monday to Thursday.
trans: 我不得不把约会从周一改到周四。

name: What's your trouble?
How long have you had it?
I should say you've caught a cold.
You need an injection.
Is it serious?
Do I need to be hospitalized?
Have you seen the doctor?
What did the doctor say?
Jack is up and about now.
The doctor says that I should take quinine.
trans: 医生说我应该服用奎宁。

name: What sort of medicine do you take?
The doctor says that I should not eat anything oily.
trans: 医生说我不能吃油腻的东西。

name: I had a shot of penicillin.
You have to be operated on.
He gave me a chest X-ray and took my blood pressure.
trans: 他给我做了X光胸透并量了血压。

name: Hello. May I speak to Mr. Green?
Just a moment.
Hold on.
He's not in. May I take a message for him?
trans: 他不在，我能替他捎个口信吗？

name: Yes, please.
Would you answer the phone please?
I want to make a long distance call.
This is Mary Speaking.
Would you tell Mr. Green that I called?
trans: 你能告诉格林先生我给他打了个电话吗？

name: I must have dialed a wrong number.
I couldn't get through.
I have to hang up now.
Would you call back tomorrow?
There's something wrong with the phone.
I tried to call you, but the line was busy.
trans: 我试着给你打电话，但老占线。

name: I have received a letter from my cousin.
I haven't heard from him for a long time.
trans: 我很久没有收到他的信了。

name: Send a postcard to me when you arrive in Shanghai.
trans: 你到上海以后给我发张明信片。

name: I put some photographs in the envelope.
trans: 我在信里夹了几张照片。

name: He hasn't answered my letter yet.
My mother mailed me a parcel.
trans: 我妈给我寄了一个包裹。

name: We keep in touch with each other by Email since he left China.
trans: 他离开中国以后，我们用Email保持联系。

name: Don't forget to put stamps on your letter.
How long does it take for a letter to get to America from Beijing?
trans: 信从北京到美国要多久？

name: You've got an express mail.
To make it fast, you can send a fax.
trans: 要想快点的话就发个传真。

name: My mother has sent me a registered letter, I guess she has something important to tell me.
trans: 我妈给我发了一封挂号信，我想她有什么重要的事情要说。

name: I find my name on the blackboard. I must have got a remittance.
trans: 我在黑板上看到我的名字，肯定有我的汇款。

name: Do you want to airmail it or not?
I drop the letter into the mailbox in front of the Post Office.
trans: 我把信塞进邮局前面的邮筒里。

name: You look radiant tonight.
It was a terrible experience.
I am on top of the world.
The dinner was wonderful.
The Christmas tree is gorgeous.
What a boring movie it is!
trans: 多么无聊的一场电影啊。

name: How can he give us such a tedious lecture!
trans: 他怎么能做这么沉闷乏味的演讲。

name: How fragrant the flowers are!
The party is making too much noise.
You look elegant in that dress.
trans: 你穿这条裙子显的很漂亮。

name: The coat doesn't suit you.
His flattery makes me sick.
We had a good time.
We enjoyed ourselves very much.
I am bored to death.
This house is for rent.
It's really a bargain.
I want to rent a furnished house.
That house is for sale. It has central heating.
trans: 此房出售，房子里有供暖设备。

name: What kind of furniture do you like?
This is a rather old house. It needs painting.
trans: 这房子挺旧的，得刷一下才行。

name: I want an apartment with two bedrooms and a kitchen.
trans: 我想要一套有两间卧室和一个厨房的公寓。

name: The houses downtown are very expensive.
How much is the rent for a month?
I feel at home living here. The landlady is very kind to me.
trans: 我觉得住在这里象在家里一样。房东太太对我很好。

name: We have a few kitchen things and a dining room set.
trans: 我们有一些厨房用具和一套餐厅设备。

name: There's no gas range in the kitchen, but you can use the electric stove.
trans: 厨房里没有煤气灶，但你可以用电炉。

name: There is a shower in the bathroom.
I have a dog, but it's very quiet.
trans: 我有一只狗，不过它很安静。

name: The room has a big closet. You can put your baggage in it.
trans: 房间里有一个很大的壁橱，你可以把你的行李放进去。

name: What will you wear for the party?
I'll wear my blue dress.
Don't you think it's too formal?
Why? What will you wear?
Just my shirt and jeans.
You should have your suit cleaned and ironed.
trans: 你应该把你的套装拿去洗烫一下。

name: You'd better put on your jacket. It's cold outside.
trans: 你最好穿上夹克，外面冷。

name: The blouse no longer fits me.
trans: 这件衬衣不再合我身了。

name: My son has outgrown these trousers.
trans: 我儿子已经长的穿不了这条裤子了。

name: The shoes are worn-out.
I don't like wearing the uniform.
Do you want to change before the banquet?
Your shoe lace is loose.
You forgot to fasten the collar buttons.
Take off your hat. It doesn't fit.
trans: 取下你的帽子，它不适合你。

name: He is a very creative student.
trans: 他是个很有创造力的学生。

name: What you have said about this is very interesting.
I cannot agree with you on this point.
trans: 在这一点上，我不能同意你的意见。

name: You've got the point.
That's the point.
The whole class is in a heated discussion.
trans: 全班同学正在热烈讨论。

name: Let's just run through the arguments for and against.
trans: 我们来看一下赞成和反对的理由。

name: Please sum up what you said just now.
trans: 请把你刚才说的总结一下。

name: Has anybody else anything to say on this?
trans: 关于这点，谁还有什么别的要说吗？

name: Does anybody share David's opinion?
trans: 有谁同意大卫的观点吗？

name: Is there any evidence to support what you have said?
trans: 有什么证据可以支持你的说法吗？

name: Well, it depends.
I don't think it's necessary for us to discuss this question any further.
trans: 我想我们没有必要进一步讨论这个问题。

name: There are always two sides to everything.
Finally, we came to an agreement.
I want to be a journalist after graduation.
If it doesn't rain tomorrow, we'll have a picnic.
trans: 如果明天不下雨，我们就去野餐。

name: As soon as he comes, we'll let him know.
You can stay as long as you pay the rent on time.
trans: 只要你按时交房租，你就能住这儿。

name: When she leaves, he'll cry for a day.
She will go into business when she likes to.
trans: 她想经商时就会去经商。

name: I'll leave for London if I finish my work today.
trans: 如果我今天完成工作，我就会去伦敦。

name: I'll work for 5 years and then go back to school.
trans: 我会工作五年，然后会学校。

name: He will become a writer if he goes on doing well in writing.
trans: 如果他仍写的这么好的话，他将成为一个作家。

name: I hope he will meet me at the airport.
trans: 我希望他能到机场接我。

name: I'm thinking of quitting the job.
I plan to learn photography.
What do you say we have a party this weekend?
trans: 我们周末开个派对，你觉得怎么样？

name: She will certainly remain single.
He will probably follow in his father's footsteps.
I would have had a much better holiday if I had stayed at home.
trans: 我要是呆在家里的话，假期会好过的多。

name: What have you been doing since I saw you last time?
trans: 自从我上次见到你以后你都在干什么？

name: If I had got enough money yesterday, I would have bought that tape.
trans: 如果我昨天钱够的话，我就买了那盒磁带了。

name: Looking back on it, I think I shouldn't have given up the contest so easily.
trans: 回过头来看，我想我不应该如此轻易的放弃那次比赛。

name: Had I taken a taxi, I wouldn't have been late.
trans: 如果我打的去的话就不会迟到了。

name: Even if you take the exam again, you won't pass it.
trans: 就算再考一次你也通不过。

name: Even if you had given him much more money, he might not have paid off the debt.
trans: 就算你给了他更多的钱，他也还不清债务。

name: What would you have done if you hadn't gone out for a picnic yesterday?
trans: 如果你昨天没有出去野餐的话。你会干什么？

name: I wish I had told him the truth.
trans: 我真希望我把真相告诉了他。

name: I wish you hadn't cheated me.
If it had been fine, we would have gone to the park.
trans: 如果天气好的话，我们就去公园了。

name: Would he have seen you if you hadn't waved to him?
trans: 如果你没有朝他挥手，他能看见你吗？

name: You should have studied much harder.
trans: 你本应该更努力的学习。

name: I had thought about arguing with the teacher about that, but I didn't have enough courage.
trans: 我本想和老师争论那个问题，但我没有足够的勇气。

name: I had thought about living with my grandparents when my parents went abroad last year.
trans: 当我的父母去年出国的时候，我本想和我的祖父母住在一起。

name: What's your favorite sport?
I like football best.
Football is my favorite.
Which do you prefer, fishing or mountain-climbing?
trans: 钓鱼和登山，你更喜欢哪一个？

name: Neither.
What do you like best, apples, pears, or bananas?
trans: 苹果，梨，香蕉，你最喜欢哪个？

name: He's crazy about Michael Jordan.
She hates boxing.
She is sick of watching boxing.
She has good taste in clothes.
What do you like to do in your spare time?
I like collecting stamps.
I prefer tea to coffee.
trans: 和咖啡相比，我更喜欢茶。

name: What do you dislike most about this movie?
trans: 这部电影你最不喜欢什么？

name: I would rather sleep than watch this movie.
trans: 我情愿睡觉也不看这部电影。

name: You should take the advice of your teacher.
That's just what I was looking for.
It might be, I suppose.
Good try, but not quite right.
trans: 是个很好的尝试，但并不完全正确。

name: That's rather disappointing.
In my opinion, your new coat is not worth so much money.
trans: 我认为你的外套不值得这么多钱。

name: Would you mind not spitting everywhere?
It's only a suggestion, you don't have to take it.
trans: 这只是一个建议，你可以不听。

name: If you really want my advice I don't think you should quit school.
trans: 如果你真想听我的意见，我想你不应该退学。

name: Thanks for your advice but I have to consider it myself.
trans: 谢谢你的建议，但我得自己想想。

name: He does not pay attention to anybody. You are wasting your time in persuading him.
trans: 他谁的话也不听，你劝他是在浪费时间。

name: I am old enough to make up my own mind.
trans: 我已经长大了，可以自己拿主意了。

name: Your work seems not satisfactory.
trans: 你的工作看起来并不令人满意。

name: What about your opinion?
I generally agree with you.
trans: 我大体上同意你的看法。

name: Would you open the door for me, please?
With pleasure.
Would you mind opening the window?
Not at all.
I wondered if you could buy me some pencils?
trans: 我不知道你是否能替我买铅笔？

name: Sure.
Would you be so kind as to lend me some money?
No problem. How much?
I hope I'm not bothering you.
I hope that will not cause you too much trouble.
trans: 我希望那不会给你添太多麻烦。

name: I really appreciate your help.
I don't want to put you to any trouble.
Excuse me, would you give me a hand?
trans: 对不起，你能帮我个忙吗？

name: I'd be glad to help.
Would you mind mailing this letter for me?
I have so many things to do before I leave.
trans: 我走之前还有很多事情要做。

name: I have to drop by the bank to get some money.
trans: 我得到银行去取一下钱。

name: Traveler's check's are very convenient for long-distance travel.
trans: 旅行支票对于长途旅行很方便。

name: Do you have anything to declare?
trans: 你有什么东西要向海关申报的吗？

name: You have to apply for a passport in advance.
You don't have to pay any duty on personal belongings.
Make it an hour and a half. We have to get more food.
trans: 等一个半小时吧，我们还得多准备些事物。

name: Shall we ask Betty to join us?
trans: 我们应该叫贝蒂一起去吗？

name: I put myself entirely in your hands.
Can you tell me the phone number of the inquiry office?
trans: 您能告诉我问讯处的电话号码吗？

name: Do you like to take a local train or an express?
trans: 你想坐普通车还是特快？

name: I have bought a ticket for a sleeper.
Have you reserved your ticket?
I would never have thought of it if you hadn't mentioned it.
trans: 如果不是你提起的话，我肯定想不到。

name: I will see you off at the railway station.
Where are you from?
What's your nationality?
What's your motherland?
Are you a native Chinese?
trans: 你是土生土长的中国人吗？

name: What's the population of China?
How many provinces do you have?
What's the capital of your country?
I come from Japan.
I was born in China and brought up in the U.S.A.
trans: 我出生在中国，在美国长大。

name: My country has an area of 500,000 square kilometers.
The capital of my country id Beijing.
We have 50 provinces.
My country is rich in natural resources.
That nation is famous for its tourism.
trans: 那个国家以旅游业闻名。

name: The biggest festival in my country is the Spring Festival.
trans: 我国最大的节日是春节。

name: Geographically, China is located in the Northern Hemisphere.
trans: 从地理位置上说，中国位于北半球。

name: In this country, the weather is usually very awful.
trans: 在这个国家，天气通常十分恶劣。

name: It is a very beautiful country with many mountains.
trans: 这是一个多山的美丽国度。

name: This country is famous for its beautiful lakes.
trans: 这个国家以其美丽的湖泊而闻名于世。

name: The land in this region is rather dry and parched.
Along the northern coast of this continent, there are many crags.
trans: 沿该大陆的北海岸线上有许多峭壁。

name: In Brazil, many ancient forests are very well preserves.
trans: 在巴西，古老的森林保存十分完好。

name: Lumbering is very important in some underdeveloped countries.
trans: 在一些不发达的国家，伐木业十分重要。

name: The scenery is very beautiful in the small islands in the Pacific Oceans.
trans: 太平洋上一些小岛的景色十分优美。

name: What kind of climate do you have in this country?
In the west of America, there are many high peeks and deep canyons.
trans: 在美国西部有许多高峰和深谷。

name: Which one is the longest river in China?
Do you get much rain in summer?
Is the plain along the river good for farming?
trans: 河畔的平原易于发展农业吗？

name: It's cold and foggy in London at this time of the year.
trans: 在每年的这个时候，伦敦寒冷而多雾。

name: Every one must receive 9 years of compulsory education.
trans: 每人必须接受九年的义务教育。

name: Children enter primary school at the age of 7.
Some students quit school due to poverty.
trans: 一些学生因贫困而辍学。

name: There is fierce competition in the college Entrance Examination.
He majored in Computers.
She is working for her double major in English and Economics.
trans: 她正在修英语和经济双学位。

name: I graduated from Yale University 5 years ago.
trans: 五年前，我从耶鲁大学毕业。

name: It is desirable to apply to good schools.
trans: 申请好学校是令人向往的。

name: Mary is in her freshman year.
Lily is a Sophomore now.
Mike is already a junior.
trans: 迈克已经大学三年级了。

name: As a senior, Peter is writing his thesis.
trans: 作为大学四年级学生，彼得正在写毕业论文。

name: Mr. Green is a member of the faculty.
In Britain, there are open universities.
There are many training classed and night classes.
What does your father do?
He is a doctor. He has his own practice.
trans: 他是个医生，他自己开业。

name: Do you have any plan for your career?
trans: 你对未来有什么计划吗？

name: I want to be a pilot of possible.
trans: 如果可能的话，我想做个飞行员。

name: I hope that I can get a decent job with a good salary.
trans: 我希望有一份既体面，收入又高的工作。

name: I have an interview next week.
Tom has opened his own business while his classmates are still slogging away at school.
trans: 当汤姆的同学还在学校苦读时，他已经开始了自己的事业。

name: I like writing, but I wouldn't take it as my career.
trans: 我喜欢协作但不愿以此为职业。

name: I worked as an intern in that firm last summer.
trans: 去年夏天我在那家商行实习。

name: He's a very efficient young man though a little proud.
trans: 他是个很有能力的人，但是有点骄傲。

name: He made a successful career in business.
trans: 他的商务生涯十分成功。

name: My cousin has just been promoted to the rank of major.
trans: 我表兄刚被提升为上校。

name: He is a manager of a famous corporation.
trans: 他是一家著名公司的经理。

name: The statesman retired as the mayor of New York.
trans: 那位政治家退休时是纽约市市长。

name: He was appointed president of the committee recently.
trans: 他最近被任命为那个革命会的总裁。

name: This area is noted for its rich soil.
trans: 这个地区以土壤肥沃著称。

name: The place is too stony for farming.
trans: 这地方太多石块，不适合耕种。

name: In the flat country, people grow wheat and raise cattle.
trans: 在这平坦的乡间，人们种指小麦，饲养牲畜。

name: He has bought 10 tractors for the village.
trans: 他为村里买了10台拖拉机。

name: What's the typical farm product in this region?
trans: 这个地区典型的农产品是什么？

name: At this time of the year farmers begin to plow their fields.
trans: 每年这个时候，农民们开始犁地。

name: Have you milked the cows?
Pile the hay in the corner.
What's the average yearly output of cars in your factory?
trans: 你们厂平均年产汽车多少台？

name: The meat packing industry is developing fast.
Car manufacturers are having a bad time.
trans: 汽车制造商的日子不好过。

name: State-owned enterprises are getting out of difficulty.
trans: 国有企业开始走上坡路。

name: How many workshops are there in your factory?
The computer industry is booming.
The information industry helps boost the global economy.
trans: 信息业推进全球经济发展。

name: Do you have any hobbies?
What are you interested in?
What are your interests?
What do you do in your spare time?
How do you spend your evenings?
trans: 夜生活你都是怎么过的？

name: Lots of people like stamp collecting.
I am a Michael Jordan fan.
Does his film appeal to you?
Do you go on picnics?
I particularly like English literature.
trans: 我对英国文学情有独钟。

name: What's so interesting about football? We girls don't like it.
trans: 足球有什么意思？我们女生不喜欢它。

name: She has a particular interest in painting.
I often take my mind off my work by reading an interesting novel.
trans: 通常我通过阅读小说使我的注意力从工作上转移过来。

name: He plays violin just for enjoyment.
trans: 他拉小提琴只是为了自娱自乐。

name: Photography is an expensive hobby.
trans: 摄影是门花费很多的爱好。

name: What's your favorite sport?
I like football.
What position do you play?
I'm a catcher.
trans: 我是个接球员（垒球运动中）。

name: Our team beat their team yesterday.
trans: 昨天，我们队打败了他们队。

name: We are sure to defeat them.
How many years have you been playing pingpong?
My favorite winter sport is skiing.
trans: 我最喜欢的动机运动是滑雪。

name: The basketball championship is exciting.
trans: 那次篮球冠军赛真激动人心。

name: I was on the track team 10 years ago.
I prefer fishing to swimming.
trans: 比起游泳，我更喜欢钓鱼。

name: She is a member of the ski club.
trans: 她是滑雪俱乐部的成员。

name: The hardest thing to learn is to be a good loser.
trans: 最难学的一点是做一个输的起的人。

name: My class went camping last summer.
trans: 去年夏天我们班去露营了。

name: He's good at lifting weights.
I subscribed to a lot of periodicals last year.
Tom reads newspapers in the afternoon.
What kind of newspapers do you read?
Newspapers and periodicals keep me updated on current affairs.
trans: 报纸和期刊让我了解时事。

name: What column do you like best?
Which do you like better, the news or the editorial?
trans: 新闻和评论你最喜欢看哪个？

name: Do you read advertisements too?
I recommend to you Time and Newsweek. They are excellent.
trans: 我向你推荐《时代》和《新闻周刊》，它们很棒。

name: Fashion is a very popular magazine in America. 《
trans: 时尚》是美国很流行的杂志。

name: What's the circulation of this magazine?
Why don't you put an advertisement in the paper to sell that old car?
trans: 为什么不在报上登广告卖旧车呢？

name: I once took a part-time job delivering the Evening Post.
trans: 我曾干过送晚报的兼职。

name: Have you read the article about the rescue of the hostage?
trans: 你看了关于营救人质的文章了吗？

name: There was much news in the morning paper today.
trans: 今天的晨报上有许多新闻。

name: My friend Tom is a reporter for the New York Times.
trans: 我朋友汤姆是《纽约时报》的记者。

name: What channel are you watching now?
There's TV coverage of the NBA tournament.
Do you have a TV guide?
You'll be on air in two minutes.
trans: 两分钟以后你会上电视。

name: Channel 5 is off the air now.
Turn up your radio please.
trans: 请你把收音机开响一点儿。

name: We can't get good pictures on our TV set.
trans: 我们的电视机图象有问题。

name: Can this radio receive short-wave?
trans: 这个收音机能收短波吗？

name: If you install an outside antenna, you will have better reception.
trans: 如果你安装了室外天线，你的电视接受效果会好点。

name: Turn down the radio please.
We'll have a soap opera series on TV this week.
trans: 这周末我们会在电视上看到一系列肥皂剧。

name: Please tune in next time.
We're broadcasting from London.
You can receive our program at short wave 37.5 MH.
trans: 你可在短波37.5赫兹上收到我们的节目。

name: There's too much static.
What's your favorite music?
Do you often go to a concert?
I hate Jazz. It's too noisy.
Do you like pop music?
I have never heard the piece before, who wrote it?
trans: 我从没听过这首曲子，谁写的？

name: What do you think of their skill?
trans: 你觉得他们演奏技术如何？

name: I find classical concerts more to my liking than rock concerts.
trans: 我觉得古典音乐会比摇滚音乐会更合我胃口。

name: I've never read a more stirring story.
trans: 我从来没读过比这更令人激动的故事。

name: He has a passion for literature.
I am most attracted by Dickens.
trans: 狄更斯的作品更吸引我。

name: I never grow tired of novels though I read them everyday.
trans: 我每天看小说，但从没厌烦过。

name: On Sundays I often spend some time reading in the library.
trans: 星期天我经常在图书馆里看些书。

name: What do think about this poem?
I like Shakespeare better than Milton.
trans: 与弥尔顿比起来，我更喜欢莎士比亚。

name: How much do you know about the works of George Eliot?
trans: 乔治?艾略特的作品你知道多少？
